clues.text: With its oldest settlement at Jamestown, it was the first of the 13 colonies to be founded
Its city of Pawtucket was founded in 1671, in time to come in for some burning during King Philip's War
George Calvert was instrumental in the founding of this colony in 1632
Originally a single province, they became 2 distinct southern colonies after separating beginning in 1712
Saybrook was its own colony until 1644, when it joined this one
Naturally, this body part can also mean a smell
"Eau de" can precede this smelly stuff, also the fourth-largest city in Germany
This smelly word precedes "-Eaters" in a brand that hopes to keep your feet smelling fresh
This 5-letter word can mean the distinct smell left by an animal & used to track prey
This word for a wine's smell is most appropriate before, for example, "of honeysuckle" or "of geranium"
One-armed basketball player Hansel Enmanuel was featured in an ad campaign from this sports drink invented in Florida
In a model walk-off in "Zoolander", this actor, as Hansel, defeats Ben Stiller by doing something indescribable with his underwear
In 1991 3-year-old Hansel won this race, the third leg of the Triple Crown
This actor had a "Hawkeye" for hunting evil as Hansel in the 2013 film "Hansel & Gretel: Witch Hunters"
A line from this musical says, "Herr Hansel Schmidt becomes Mrs. Hedwig Robinson"
Goldilocks falls asleep in the bed of this character
The Eagles had a song about "Life In" this, which the California DMV says is also known as the left or number 1
"Pray for us sinners" is a line from it
When printing photos (yes, people still do that), the intermediate rinse called this comes before fixing & washing
To help with physical therapy, this type of cognitive training might have a patient walk while counting by 2s
In "Casino Royale" she's described as "M's private secretary"
Gandalf said to him, "You shall go away with Mr. Frodo!"
In this Cormac McCarthy novel John Grady Cole & his pal Rawlins are hired to tame some equines
In this Wilde work Algernon's manservant is named Lane, while Jack has a butler named Merriman
Frank helps Cora kill her hubby but is wrongly convicted of a murder he didn't commit in this James M. Cain novel
Sylvester Stallone, Jason Statham & Jet Li are among the less than precious title mercenaries in this 2010 film
"Pain don't hurt" is one of Patrick Swayze's iconic (?) lines from this 1989 cheese- & slugfest
Jann Mardenborough became a pro race car driver by using this racing simulation video game, also the 2023 biopic about him
This star-filled 1963 film featuring some epic Steve McQueen motorcycle scenes was (very) loosely based on a true story
"El Mariachi", "Desperado" & "Once Upon a Time in Mexico" make up this director's "Mexico Trilogy"

rounds.comments: (Ken: This is a road trip featuring some highway signs used in recent years.)

clues.text: Drivers entering from Maryland once saw the welcome signs for this state that called it "Small Wonder"
This farming state has welcomed visitors with "Fields of Opportunities"
A southern sign says, "Welcome to" this Lynyrd Skynyrd title
Louisiana's sign includes both "Welcome" & this French equivalent
Once on Michigan's welcome signs, this 2-word phrase that doesn't just refer to size was also on its license plates from 1983 to 2007
Writer Prawer Jhabvala, helpful Dr. Westheimer
The real-world Mr. Law, the fictional Mr. Fawley
A Coen brother, a "Last of Us" father
Reynolds of the visual arts, Bell of classical music
Digital media titan Peretti, actor Hill
The New Testament's I Timothy says, "Drink no longer water, but use a little" of this "for thy stomach's sake"
Cole Porter wrote, "I get no kick from" this, "mere alcohol doesn't thrill me at all"
This cocktail may be dry, like the wit of H.L. Mencken, said to have called it "the only American invention as perfect as the sonnet"
In "Anna Christie" Greta Garbo requested this, "ginger ale on the side. And don't be stingy, baby"
It's the line in "Treasure Island" that precedes & follows "drink and the devil had done for the rest"
clues.response: yo-ho-ho and a bottle of rum

clues.text: Despite the name, it can be 25 feet long in the abdominal cavity
This type of special tribunal is set up for simplified litigation of damages below a certain amount of money
A group of young fish, or a dismissive term for the young or insignificant
In July 2004 in Thailand, Angelina Jolie had a tiger tattooed here
Established in 1953, this government agency provides support to start-ups & existing companies with programs & loans
Fully loaded, this ship launched in 1911 weighed, or displaced, more than 52,000 tons--no match for a monster iceberg
"The head that wears" this might ache wearing the solid gold, nearly 5-pound St. Edward's one used in a 2023 ceremony
Kind of light & heavy at the same time, the net weight of one of these cotton units is around 500 pounds
Detroit's big fist honoring this "Brown Bomber" & boxing champ is a heavyweight itself at about 8,000 pounds
Benedictine, this breed of dog known for its rescues, was reported to weigh in at 357 pounds... woof!
The climax of the Westminster Kennel Club dog show is this award
Max Dale Cooper got a Robert Koch Award & 100,000 euros in part for figuring out how leukocytes, also called these cells, work & fail
In the early 20th c. these were given out for literature; Baron Pierre de Coubertin won one under a pen name for "Ode to Sport"
In 2023 Paul Giamatti, a graduate of this university & son of its 19th president, got an honorary doctorate there
As is often said when a Tony Award is given out, they're from this "American" organization

rounds.text: 2 schools in the Southeastern Conference are located in cities with this same name but in different states
